e4: The current policy, while misleading, is transparent. Investors are aware of the adjustment needed. Switching to an unbiased policy abruptly could lead to some investors misinterpreting the true earnings situation and making poor investment decisions. It might be wiser to phase out the bias gradually, educating investors along the way.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy. It avoids intentional manipulation or obscuring of information that could materially mislead investors. Investors should be able to confidently rely on reported figures as a true and fair reflection of the company's financial performance. Gradual transitions and clear communication about any policy changes are crucial for maintaining trust.
e6: Yes, I would ask management to explore a phased approach to transitioning to an unbiased reporting policy.  I'd want to understand their thoughts on communicating this transition clearly to investors and mitigating any potential confusion during the changeover.
